TextBody:
Hi Olivier,

Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
- What is the impact of the issue on your business?
- What are the steps to reproduce?
- Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
- When did this issue start?
- Can you please let me know the Server version (if not already known) on which the issue is encountered?
- On what platform is your Endpoint Protector hosted? (on-prem, AWS, GCP, Azure, Hosted by EPP on AWS)
- If you have not, can you provide screen shots of the smtp configuration?

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Mo1U9:ref
Subject: Trouble Sending Email Alerts from Endpoint Protector    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0Mo1U9:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000Mo1U9:ref

Hello,

Thank you for your reply.

*- What is the impact of the issue on your business?*
I am unable to use the DLP solution as it does not produce alerts.
*- What are the steps to reproduce?*
[image: Screenshot 2025-03-11 at 19.41.01.png]
Test email does not get sent.
*- Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you
tried?*
Tried switching multiple ports and switching from SSL to TLS and vice-versa.
*- When did this issue start?*
Since the start of using the tool.
*- Can you please let me know the Server version (if not already known) on
which the issue is encountered?*
Version 5.9.4.1
*- On what platform is your Endpoint Protector hosted? (on-prem, AWS, GCP,
Azure, Hosted by EPP on AWS)*
Hosted by EPP
*- If you have not, can you provide screen shots of the smtp configuration?*
[image: Screenshot 2025-03-11 at 19.47.40.png]


Kind Regards,

*Olivier Adamczyk**   I   ARB Interactive*


*Cybersecurity Engineer*

13802 N Scottsdale Rd Suite 151-94 Scottsdale AZ 85254-3403

e: olivier@arbinteractive.com

TextBody:
Hi Olivier,

When using the credentials, did you use your account password or did you use an app password?
For Gmail to work correctly you need to set up 2-factor authentication and create an app password to use on the server. This is a requirement from Google.
Can you please try it and let me know the outcome?

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com

TextBody:
Hi Olivier,

If 2FA is active, and you go inside its menu, you should see App Passwords. Please create one and use that one in the password field in the SMTP configuration, not your workspace password.

If it still doesn't work let me know and we will set up a meeting to look into it.

Thank you,
Eduard Nut
Technical Support Engineer

Endpoint Protector now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection
eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd
www.endpointprotector.com

>>

>> Passwords. Please create one and use that one in the password field in the
>> SMTP configuration, not your workspace password.

>>> Hi Olivier,
>>>
>>> When using the credentials, did you use your account password or did you
>>> use an app password?
>>> For Gmail to work correctly you need to set up 2-factor authentication
>>> and create an app password to use on the server. This is a requirement from
>>> Google.
>>> Can you please try it and let me know the outcome?
>>>
>>> Thank you,
